meanings.sent1: I have many options for lunch today.
meanings.sent2: She considered all her options before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: Having so many options can be overwhelming sometimes.
meanings.sent4: Life is like a box of options, you never know what you're going to get.
meanings.sent5: The world is full of endless options waiting to be explored.

meanings.definition: The power or right to choose
meanings.sent1: He exercised his options and selected the best one.
meanings.sent2: In this country, everyone has the freedom to exercise their options.
meanings.sent3: With great power comes great options.
meanings.sent4: Having options is like holding the key to your own destiny.
meanings.sent5: The options available to us shape our lives in profound ways.

meanings.definition: A financial instrument that gives the holder the right to buy or sell an asset at a specified price
meanings.sent1: Investors can trade options to hedge their risks.
meanings.sent2: She bought an option to purchase the stock at a later date.
meanings.sent3: Trading options requires a good understanding of the market.
meanings.sent4: Options are like a financial safety net in the world of investments.
meanings.sent5: Understanding options trading opens up a world of financial opportunities.
